page.title: 06Shopping and Trade
page.content: Within the area under study, only the village of Hornby has any commercial enterprises, although there is one very small restaurant in Gressingham village. There is a small industrial estate at the Southern end of Hornby which employs a few people. Lamb's Garage provides servicing and M.O.T. facilities for motor cars as well as the usual petrol, oil and sundries. Hornby has a Post Office which provides the usual range of services and which also carries a small selection of gifts,clothing and souvenirs. The general stores provide groceries, confectionaries, alchoholic drinks and magazines and newspapers. The butcher provides the usual range of meats and dairy produce and the hardware store supplies hardware, D.I.Y. materials and garden equipment.
